CatDescriptText: Miss Thelma Cottan, 1519 Sedgwick Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: �Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?� answer reads: �I don�t think that they should become executives or directors but it is all right for them to invest. They should not be executives or directors because they couldn�t do other work in the ministry.  As an investor, this will not take too much of their time.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Cottan wearing light colored sleeveless blouse with large collar and bow, holding umbrella, standing on corner of Penn Avenue and Seventh Street with Century Building and Seventh Street Bridge in background, Downtown
